articles.headline: Anti-Abortion Groups Join Battles Over Frozen Embryos
articles.snippet: As couples go to court over embryos, groups argue that such cases should be decided by the legal standard used in child-custody disputes.
articles.abstract: As couples go to court over embryos, groups argue that such cases should be decided by the legal standard used in child-custody disputes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anti-abortion groups are seeking a foothold on a new battlefield: custody disputes over frozen embryos.

articles.headline: A Push for Gender Equality at the Davos World Economic Forum, and Beyond
articles.snippet: Investments are expected to be diversified so why is that logic not applied to gender, asks Theresa Whitmarsh, one of the women leading an initiative for parity in finance at the elite gathering.
articles.abstract: Investments are expected to be diversified so why is that logic not applied to gender, asks Theresa Whitmarsh, one of the women leading an initiative for parity in finance at the elite gathering.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a top executive in the financial industry, Theresa Whitmarsh is accustomed to being the only woman in the room. That was the case the last two years when she attended the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, a conclave for the world’s most powerful leaders and tycoons.

articles.headline: Sarah Palin Endorses Donald Trump, Which Could Bolster Him in Iowa
articles.snippet: The backing of Mrs. Palin, the former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee, provides Mr. Trump with a potential boost less than two weeks before the Iowa caucuses.
articles.abstract: The backing of Mrs. Palin, the former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee, provides Mr. Trump with a potential boost less than two weeks before the Iowa caucuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMES, Iowa — Sarah Palin, the former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee who became a Tea Party sensation and a favorite of grass-roots conservatives, endorsed Donald J. Trump in Iowa on Tuesday, providing him with a potentially significant boost just 13 days before the state’s caucuses.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: A Deadly Deployment, a Navy SEAL’s Despair
articles.snippet: Fellow officers saw the death of Cmdr. Job W. Price, which was ruled a suicide, as a cautionary tale of how men were ground down by years of fighting and losing comrades.
articles.abstract: Fellow officers saw the death of Cmdr. Job W. Price, which was ruled a suicide, as a cautionary tale of how men were ground down by years of fighting and losing comrades.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was his last night of what his men were already calling a cursed deployment in Afghanistan.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Kulish and Christopher Drew

articles.headline: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan Apologizes in Flint Water Crisis
articles.snippet: “I’m sorry, and I will fix it,” he said in a State of the State address in which he focused on an issue that has consumed the state and drawn national attention.
articles.abstract: “I’m sorry, and I will fix it,” he said in a State of the State address in which he focused on an issue that has consumed the state and drawn national attention.
articles.lead_paragraph: LANSING, Mich. — Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan issued a sweeping apology on Tuesday to the residents of Flint for a contaminated water supply. He pledged to promptly release his emails about the issue, and laid out more specifics than had previously been known about the state’s handling of the matter.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: America’s Best Days May Be Behind It
articles.snippet: A new book argues that the great strides in American innovation and prosperity made from 1920 through 1970 are unlikely to be repeated.
articles.abstract: A new book argues that the great strides in American innovation and prosperity made from 1920 through 1970 are unlikely to be repeated.
articles.lead_paragraph: Take a look back at some of the most popular TV programs of the mid-1960s — “The Dick Van Dyke Show,” “Bewitched,” even “The Beverly Hillbillies” — and what do you see?

articles.headline: Oil Market Tests Banks’ Ability to Weather Losses
articles.snippet: While plummeting oil prices are cutting into profits, they are not threatening big banks’ capital cushions, analysts say, thanks to rigorous regulation.
articles.abstract: While plummeting oil prices are cutting into profits, they are not threatening big banks’ capital cushions, analysts say, thanks to rigorous regulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Low oil prices are rattling global markets and destabilizing economies around the world. They are also posing one of the first big tests to the United States banking system since the financial crisis.

articles.headline: Taliban Attack at Bacha Khan University in Pakistan Renews Fears
articles.snippet: At least 20 people were gunned down, reviving the trauma and outrage from a deadly attack on a school in Peshawar in 2014.
articles.abstract: At least 20 people were gunned down, reviving the trauma and outrage from a deadly attack on a school in Peshawar in 2014.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Attacks on education have long been a signature atrocity of the Pakistani Taliban, whose militants have set schools on fire, banished girls from classrooms and gunned down students at their desks in a quest to impose an extremist ideology on Pakistani society.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh, Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud and Ismail Khan

articles.headline: ‘Noon Swoon,’ Then Recovery That May Signal Market Turnaround
articles.snippet: The major indexes in the United States were all down more than 3 percent but then staged a turnaround in the final hour.
articles.abstract: The major indexes in the United States were all down more than 3 percent but then staged a turnaround in the final hour.
articles.lead_paragraph: Soon after midday on Wednesday, panic selling seemed to be seizing the United States stock market.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Neil Gough

articles.headline: Tech’s ‘Frightful 5’ Will Dominate Digital Life for Foreseeable Future
articles.snippet: By just about every metric, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft are getting larger, more entrenched in their own sectors, more powerful in new sectors and better protected from competition.
articles.abstract: By just about every metric, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft are getting larger, more entrenched in their own sectors, more powerful in new sectors and better protected from competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: There’s a little parlor game that people in Silicon Valley like to play. Let’s call it, Who’s Losing?
